website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy, heavy-duty metal dustpan with a convenient handle.
pros: Loop handle makes it easy to hold and hang
Edge is fine enough to pick up very small debris
cons: The label on this dustpan is a bit difficult to remove

customer_reviews.title: One star merely for that obnoxious yellow label
customer_reviews.text: On the front of the dustpan, which could just as easily be stuck to the bottom of the dustpan. It has to be removed because whatever you sweep up will, over time, stick to that obnoxious label. It took forever to get it off and required hot water and Goo Gone. I don't appreciate having more work thrust upon me for no reason other than inconsiderate advertising. Looks like a decent dustpan, and it's unfortunate you only get 1 star, but that's what happens when you don't consider the consumer. Have a great day.
customer_reviews.author: Book LoverTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Make I got a fake? Worst dustpan ever.
customer_reviews.text: The dustpan comes with a giant yellow sticker on the front that is impossible to remove. I’ve tried everything. Now it’s a sticky mess. And the dustpan feels thin and cheap...I really don’t understand all the five star reviews. It also says, wash hands after handling because there are cancer causing materials used in it. No thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Dust Pan
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a heavy duty garage type dust pan. This seems to do the job. It isn't quite as heavy duty as the probably 50 year old unit I used to have, but it should be fine. I knock 1/2 Star off for being Made in China. I knock another 1/2 Star off because of some mystery blobs in the paint on the bottom of the pan. They are either paint/powder-coat blemishes or, paint over rust. I guess a few years from now I'll know. I certainly am not going to return it for that. All in all, a nice, reasonably heavy-duty dust pan.
customer_reviews.author: Rational

customer_reviews.title: Best designed dustpans
customer_reviews.text: After years of having to replace the standard design of black metal dustpan that always seems to break at the handle area due to metal fatigue I was in the market for a different, more efficient design. Your product was just what I thought I might be looking for. I bought two of them I was so impressed. They are everything I hoped they would be so I am a very happy customer!.
customer_reviews.author: Jdarbys

customer_reviews.title: Good for home and shop
customer_reviews.text: I love this dust pan. Good simple quality durable construction. The lip is thin sheet metal, it stays rigid and flat against the floor, allowing me to easily and cleanly sweep all size of particles onto it, leaving very little behind. Light enough for daily use around the house and heavy duty enough to perform well in the garage or shop. I bought two!
customer_reviews.author: RonaldE

customer_reviews.title: This is the real thing. The way things should be made.
customer_reviews.text: This dustpan is excellent. It's the real McCoy, not a cheap throw together. I use it constantly for regular dustpan work as well as the all important fire safety when dealing with a wood stove and hot clinkers. The leading edge is perfectly straight, flat, and no ridiculous thickness at the edge to cause it not to get loaded properly. The corrugated back is done right so it's not flimsy waiting to fold or crack on you. Handle is securely attached and placing the lift points where they need to be. Take good care of it and it will take care of you. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Gets ALL the dirt and is well made
customer_reviews.text: The dustpan is fantastic for picking up fine dirt. I kept getting dustpans with a rubber edge thinking it would lay tight to the floor only to find when I lifted it up, there was “the line”. Sweep again and... another line of dirt! This dustpan is sturdy and lays right on the floor, no more lines of dirt left! Another advantage is the size. I can sweep up a ton and the back is high enough to catch everything. Some other reviews have complained about the yellow sticker on it. It doesn’t bother me at all. I’m not using it as artwork on display. Great dustpan for heavy use!
customer_reviews.author: 2LPicole

customer_reviews.title: Metal Dustpan (:
customer_reviews.text: I could not find a metal pan any place in my town. Last February when our snow hit, my hubby got a little aggressive with pushing a piece of wood into our stove and sparks flew out on our rug. I grabbed the first dustpan I found, forgetting it was plastic! Well, it wasn't a very decorative pattern on our carpet!! I HATE those plastic dustpans, especially when they melt. I ordered 2 of the Edward 12" Dustpans and I love them. They are light to use and have room for more sweepings than any dustpan I have owned. They are a little spendy but will last a good long time.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Not the old school one I used to have
customer_reviews.text: I have Rubbermaid dustpans that are heavier duty than this item. I am disappointed in the weight and sturdiness of this unit. The handle is too wide to be comfortable unless you have large hands. I wanted an industrial weight unit similar to what I used to have in my shop and this isn't it. The metal is thin enough gauge that it bends quite easily and doesn't look like it will hold up to long term use. We will see how that works out but right now, not thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Don O

customer_reviews.title: The label  is nearly impossible to remove.
customer_reviews.text: The unit has a large label in the middle of the pan. It is nearly impossible to remove. I finally resorted to brake cleaner and a scraper. What s the purpose of making the label so robust? It also leaves a sticky residue behind that holds the dust you are sweeping. Very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Jim_and_Denise

customer_reviews.title: Made very sturday.
customer_reviews.text: We use the dustpan for outside yard waste. Living under a large oak tree we get a lot of debris that needs swept up from the driveway. The acorns and leaves in the fall keep us busy on a daily basis. We could not find a good metal dustpan locally to replace a broken plastic one. This has been a great buy, it is light but strong enough to hold a large amount. Very handy and should last many years.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: 9 year old approved
customer_reviews.text: Sturdiness: 5/5 Lightweight: 5/5 Easy to use: 5/5 Recommend: Yes Yes. It has that annoying sticker. I haven't figured out how to remove it yet. Despite the sticker, this is a solidly performing dustpan. It is lightweight and heavy duty. I anticipate having this loan around a long time. My 9 year old son thinks this pan is the bees knees and actually looks for things to sweep so he can use this. As a mother, I'd recommend this pan on that fact alone. Even he can see how great this dustpan works.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Form & Function
customer_reviews.text: It may be just a dust pan, but have you ever had a bad one? I think it's worth reviewing that this is not only attractive and classic looking (I don't even mind leaving it out) but very high quality in both coating and weight. The precision edging makes it so that that you only have one sweep and everything goes in. I haven't had to buy one in years, and after using many bad ones at relative's and friend's houses, I was nervous I'd be stuck with a lemon. Not the case with this--so glad I did my homework!
customer_reviews.author: Jaimie

customer_reviews.title: Practical product that belongs in every home
customer_reviews.text: Why bother with wimpy plastic dust pans that don't have the edge to catch all your dirt. Only a metal quality-made pan with a thin edge can do the job. This is a pan that will last FOREVER. It is sturdy, yet lightweight without feeling like an inferior product. This product is for you if you want to buy a product once in your life, use it, and be happy with its performance. I wish everything could be made this way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Now This is a REAL Dustpan !
customer_reviews.text: The Real Thing : "Old Fashioned" ( when they made things right . . . just like I grew up with ) , large, ample room to hold everything, sturdy, steel, NOT PLASTIC ! . . . It REALLY works ! I'm so Glad I bought it ! ( I got one for inside the house and one for outside in the Garden. ) I'm Happy ! ( Who would have thought that a simple dustpan could make you so happy ! ) ( I'm Happy because it is the Real Thing ! ) Thank You !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Dustpan - I am in love - and recommendations on removing stiker work!
customer_reviews.text: I love this dustpan. I have had it for a little over a month now and it works so great with no need for a little rubber/silicone edge that will break off. The sticker that other people complain about does come off easily - I used the hot water method someone else recommended. Run hot water on back of dustpan, I only did it for 10 seconds so you might eliminate sticky residue if you run the water longer. Still, the sticky residue I had left was easily removed with olive oil and rubbing for 1 to 2 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B.

customer_reviews.title: Strong, heavy duty dust pan
customer_reviews.text: Really like this dust pan. I wanted something that would hold up to heavy use and this one does. The handle is very study and attached in such a way that it is very strong. I don't have a square nose shovel, so I have been using this to scoop up gravel and rocks off of the sidewalk. Very good dust pan. Should last for the rest of my life (I'm 74).
customer_reviews.author: Ron C.

customer_reviews.title: Never buy another dust pan!
customer_reviews.text: YES!!! FINALLY found the perfect dust pan! My children kept breaking our regular plastic dustpans, upgraded to this and WOW! Game changer for sure! Super sturdy, built perfectly well, hits the floor tight so dust doesn’t get left behind. Can’t imagine sweeping without it!
customer_reviews.author: Tami

customer_reviews.title: Large white sticker permanently glued - DUMB
customer_reviews.text: Un-removable sticker. The dust pan is fine & exactly what I expected EXCEPT the seller permanently glued a large white paper sticker to the damn thing. It’s a 10 minute job trying to remove it and impossible to not also remove much of the powder coating in the process. It would have been thoughtful & would have demonstrated a little care & concern for the end user to use a removable adhesive.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: broomin' up the mess
customer_reviews.text: I hate it that a nice sweeped pile of dust and dirt cannot be swept into the dustpan without leaving lines of dust across the floor. This dustpan goes a long way to solving that. It is metal, strong, and a small raised lip. Lots more can be swept up with the same effort. Plus it is handsome, if the broom closet is where you look for aesthetics.
customer_reviews.author: N. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent...however
customer_reviews.text: Surely tired of using my other metal dustpan due to the many kinks at the end with most of the clean up going under the pan instead of in it. This one is tough enough to take some knocks and still collect the rubbish in the pan. Easy to hang up. Only con, for me anyway, is that the supplied brush is way too soft making it half a dozen sweeps rather just the couple. I would have much preferred to have one that has tougher Brussels, considering it is comes with a metal pan
customer_reviews.author: David Edwards and Tina Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great dust pan
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of flimsy plastic dust pans when the only one I could find had a huge crack, almost breaking off the handle. Searched Amazon for a good one. I bought this dust pan because it looked large and sturdy. I like that the handle is a folded, hollow metal tube rather than just a rolled piece attached to the pan. I do not believe this dust pan will ever break. The only hazard might be losing it.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Should say made for Edward Tool’s and list China under ...
customer_reviews.text: Should say made for Edward Tool’s and list China under manf. Those misdirections aside it’s is decently made. Due to other reviews comments I just might not attempt label removal and will hope handle holes are not dust portals. But why coming out of China does it cost top dollar. Is it due to the Edwards name it doesn’t deserve? Powder coating is no match for concrete.
customer_reviews.author: West Desert Enthusiasts

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Value
customer_reviews.text: Most people don't really pay attention to their dustpans, but this dustpan will change your mind. It has a large, easy-to-grasp handle and a huge 12" width that makes clean up faster. Best of all, it's incredibly strong. I used it to clean up broken plaster during some remodeling and it just kept coming back for more. I've bought two more, one for me and one as part of a housewarming gift. But it--you'll love it!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis O'Donnell

customer_reviews.title: This is not very sharp on the edge
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made metal dustpan. The only problem I have is that is isn't sharp enough on the edge to not leave a line. So you have to sweep and move , sweep and move the pan. I have to do this two or three times to get the dust line up. That means this dustpan will only be used when I do outside work. I'm still looking for a good indoor dustpan.
customer_reviews.author: K. Zamudio

customer_reviews.title: The sticker is hugely ugly and, so far, impossible to remove.
customer_reviews.text: Liked the dust pan very much but so far I've found the sticker impossible to remove; hence the 3 stars. Have tried various products designed to remove stickers but they don't work. Now I have a nasty looking mess on my new dust pan. Would never have purchased this particular dust pan if I had known the big, bright yellow, ugly sticker would cause such a problem.
customer_reviews.author: R. Varnum

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you have puppies
customer_reviews.text: Butch and Sundance, my new puppies, love to dig in the flower bed next to the patio. Can't tell you how many plastic dust pans I've been through, either because they break or get eaten by the boys. This is EXACTLY what I needed to scoop up the dirt and scrape mud off the concrete. Why did it take me so long to find this?!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C Livingston

customer_reviews.title: Why put the sticker direcly on the product?
customer_reviews.text: The dust pan is as advertised. I like it however why is the UPC sticker directly on the product? I am having a heck of a time getting it off. I don't want this dustpan hanging on my wall with a price sticker on it. I have tried simple green, and alcohol to remove it. It will not come off. I'm actually thinking about returning it if I can't get it off. Shrink wrap it and put the sticker on the plastic. WHY????
customer_reviews.author: David McCracken

customer_reviews.title: Love this dustpan
customer_reviews.text: Love this dustpan, just the right size, like the handle design, like that it is black but I bet I would buy another one if I could get it in other colors like pink, orange or turquoise. It is hanging in my kitchen and so I appreciate the good design and the fact that it can be kept clean. I find that when housekeeping tools are out in the open, I can get people to use them easier so good design is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: The dreaded yellow sticker.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't read the reviews before I bought this, I mean it's a dustpan right? Then I peel back a corner of the sticker and pull away....the corner of the sticker. Run it under hot water wipe off the sticker then use vegetable oil to remove the sticky left behind. Way more effort than should be needed for a dustpan but looks nice beside my fire place I dont foresee any problems with it in the future.
customer_reviews.author: MHosh

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy dust pan
customer_reviews.text: It's a Sturdy dust pan. I was tired of the cheap plastic ones always cracking. This one will hold up. It does have a label on it which apparently is hard to remove. But it's a dustpan, not a showpiece. I've even used it in the yard as It's scoops of a tremendous amount of dirt without even flexing.
customer_reviews.author: Steve-o

customer_reviews.title: Amazing dustpan; sturdy and looks great
customer_reviews.text: Amazing dustpan; sturdy and looks great. If you check out previous customer's picture you will get a sense of what the pan actually looks like. It's more of a matte black as opposed to the glossy black that is shown. Only complaint I have is that they need to find a new sticker manufacturer/printer, because the label was really difficult to take off and left a lot of residue (will have to purchase goo gone to get rid of the residue). Other than that, great dustpan.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Beyond amazing dustpan!
customer_reviews.text: So, I know it's a little crazy to be this excited about a dustpan. But I've spent 50+ years of my life being anywhere from minorly irked to majorly grumpy when a dustpan leaves that lil' line of dirt and grime underneath when I'm sweeping. This pan fits snugly to the ground, it leaves no trail of dirt, and I'm confident that the metal edge isn't going to warp like cheap plastic or get dinged up. I love it. I'm (almost) looking forward to sweeping and mopping now!
customer_reviews.author: ImJustTheMom

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I’m very disappointed with this product and Amazon purchase. In spite of the product description stating this dustpan will not chip, it arrived with a chip on the back of the dustpan. It also arrived with an adhesive label on the front of the dustpan which took me 30 minutes to remove. I find the handle uncomfortable and too large to get a good grip on it. Since I needed this for outdoor holiday cleaning, I am not returning it but would if I had time. I don’t like writing negative reviews, but I hope this information gets to the manufacturer and seller. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Joleen D.

customer_reviews.title: A straight flat edge
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a metal dustpan, some times I use it to clean out ashes (and embers) from my wood stove. But normally I use it to clean up construction mess. The metal dust pans I can get (and have bought and used before) from the local big box stores are terrible--the bottom edge is not flat and debris just sweeps under the edge. But this dustpan's edge is straight and lays flat on the floor and is pretty thin so most of the dust actually goes into the pan and not underneath it! My only suggestion is, for the construction site, I would like to see this company offer a larger version dust pan. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Randall S

customer_reviews.title: Well made dustpan,  wide enough, strong enough and lightweight to be most useful
customer_reviews.text: I like this black dustpan. It works like it is supposed to work without any hassles. It is lightweight although it is very strong. It can hold a lot of ashes/coals to put into the ash bucket. It is well made and NOT a cheap looking piece to be around a nice fireplace or fire pit. Has a substantial handle that won't break off.
customer_reviews.author: BottleTree Farm

customer_reviews.title: That Old-Time Quality
customer_reviews.text: People of a certain age will always know and appreciate the quality of workmanship from days past. This dustpan reminds of me of certain items of such craftsmanship from my youth - they seemed they would last forever and certainly outlive their owners. The Edward Tools Black fits that description - I doubt I will outlive it.
customer_reviews.author: ACIM Kid

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sturdy dust pan, not cheap plastic junk that will break. I specifically bought this for yardwork, since I have a walnut tree to deal with every fall. I have no doubt that it could get the job done; I just wish the sides were a little deeper, to hold more. I would recommend buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: SAS

customer_reviews.title: It's great when a product is simply everything that it should be...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new dust pan and this more than meets my expectations in all the ways it should-sturdy and well engineered. As an engineer myself I did make an adjustment to accommodate a 'lady' hand by narrowing down the handle with a bit of vice pressure which went well giving testimate to quality of construction and materials. I could go on to comment then on the leading edge which is important in attaining a clean sweep pickup. It is angled nicely and the metal gauge substantial giving no opportunity for flexing. I recommend this dust pan.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Kehn

customer_reviews.title: Great dust pan!
customer_reviews.text: I had already purchased the "bigger brother" of this dust pan a while back. It was just too big for house use. So I got this one. It measures up perfectly to use in my house. It's light weight durable and can hang any place. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a good one!
customer_reviews.author: Randyman

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty dustpan
customer_reviews.text: This dustpan is exactly what I wanted and needed!! It's sturdy and I am using it to clean out decorative rock from my flower beds. I can scrape the rocks into the dustpan and dump into my wheelbarrow and not tear up my hands while doing this. It arrived quickly (2 days) and in solid packaging. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry W

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, except...
customer_reviews.text: It's a niggling thing, but the huge paper label that was stuck on the inside of the pan cannot be removed easily, and was crooked. I got this for my shop to go with my nice corn-whisk broom, and I wanted it to be sturdy and look good. If it wasn't for that stupid sticker that is ow just partially torn off, I'd be 100% happy.
customer_reviews.author: Hammm3r

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Really sturdy and easy to handle. People complained about the sticker on the front. They must have changed it because I had no problem taking it off
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality for indoor use recommended
customer_reviews.text: I'd say for a Chinese made dust pan pretty heavy duty. They almost give the illusion its USA made, but no chance. Like it though with heavy metal and good coating of paints or finish. About a foot wide. Its not giant.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Functional
customer_reviews.text: I had a metal dustpan I used for years. It got dropped by accident and the edge got bent. Metal edge works better than rubber edges which do not remain level.
customer_reviews.author: Smartshopper

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy sticker removal in 30 seconds!
customer_reviews.text: Great old school metal dust pan. All I can say is the MEN that complain about the sticker should ask their wife nicely to use their wife or girlfriends. blow dryer and fingernail polish remover for 2 minutes and quit complaining!! The real men already know to use their heat gun and acetone!
customer_reviews.author: Lee James

customer_reviews.title: Good upgrade from plastic indoor pans
customer_reviews.text: It's all metal, coated to help delay rust. There's no plastic on the tapered front. A big plus as this is the first part that gets torn off damaged on other dustpans I've had. I would not use this for a shop pan, too small and not heavy duty enough to pick up metal and other shop scrap. Good upgrade from plastic indoor pans.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: This is the dustpan you need for your shop or home
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy dust pan for your shop. I like mine. I was tired of stealing the spouses dust pan (and putting it back) so I got this. Works well, has sufficient heft to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Labitt

customer_reviews.title: Will Last Years
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty and modern looking. Doesn't pick up the dust at the bottom of my sweepings without a few tries but what dust pan can? Hey.. wait a minute... Why is it called a dust pan?... More of a crumb-size-and-larger picker upper.
customer_reviews.author: Cup o' Jojo

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Not one of those clunky, hard to use dust pans. Very sturdy. It will certainly outlast the crappy plastic dust pans that are so common.
customer_reviews.author: Sue S. from Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Well made, functional, durable-and pretty!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Not only does it look and feel amazing...it works great. Very easy to sweep into. It’s heavy enough to set on the floor and sweep the dirt gently into it. Very happy with my purchase! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Broek

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, large dustpan
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of the cheap plastic dustpans not lasting and not being large enough, so this sucker is a real pleasure to me! Never have to buy another dustpan!
customer_reviews.author: Garbo916

customer_reviews.title: poor product
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of these. Both came with a bend diagonally across the pan. The metal is thin, weak, and bendable by hand. I bent it to a straighter shape and will go ahead and use it. It is a cheaply made product. I do like the handle which is stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Manny Ponce

customer_reviews.title: Poor Packaging, can hardly remove sticker
customer_reviews.text: Dust pan is fine; however, it comes with a giant yellow sticker on the front side that is near impossible to peel off. I don’t understand manufacturers that do this. Have they never used their own products? Take a little more pride in your work. 15 minutes of cleaning with a solvent and it’s still not completely off.
customer_reviews.author: David Todd

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Steel Dustpan for home or commercial use!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Steel Dustpan for home or commercial use! Using for clean-up on drywall installation...it works much better than a heavy-duty plastic dustpan. Glad I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jimcnh

customer_reviews.title: Just what I've been looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I'd gone through other dustpans that bent, chipped, and just wouldn't last. This one is the absolute best thing I've found for those messy chores! It's light, yet VERY sturdy. The perfect size, the perfect weight. I can't imagine anything being better.
customer_reviews.author: M. Davis

customer_reviews.title: The last dustpan you’ll need.
customer_reviews.text: This dustpan is exactly as pictured and better quality than I expected. We bought a dustpan that will never have to be replaced. It’s sturdy, had a low profile edge making it easy to sweep up fine dust, and fits well on a command hook. No more plastic dustpans for us!
customer_reviews.author: Tyrrhenian

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dust pan to use in our garage after we had done some drywall work. It's sturdy and can hold a lot of debris. I use it with a straw broom and it seems to pick up the dirt easily. I like that it has a loop on the end - I plan to get a hook to hang it on the wall of our garage once we're done with the drywall.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissie

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty?
customer_reviews.text: Really nothing special about this. It’s much lighter than expected which makes me question it’s durability. I’d probably go with something less expensive next time.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Moose Long

customer_reviews.title: Solid addition to my shop.
customer_reviews.text: Not too big, or too small, just the right size to use with my hand brush in my work shop. It is well made. Whoever designed it, made the right choice regarding its size and weight. It is rigid enough for its purpose, but not too heavy. If the paint holds it will be a very useful tool for a very long time. My only complaint is the irritating label glued to the top surface. Impossible to remove in one single action. You have to rip off the top layer plastic and spent some time on soaking and scrubbing the subsequent layers – time and energy consuming process. Because of that I deducted one star from otherwise good product.
customer_reviews.author: Verinus

customer_reviews.title: Buy it you'll like it!
customer_reviews.text: Study and well made. Color is adhered good. Perfect all around size. The sicker is hard to get off - used a hair dryer and then even some orange oil goo remover still glue on it, but it's on the scoop side and doesn't show when hanging - works great nice floor seal not to heavy and Cute hanging on the wall of my laundry room!
customer_reviews.author: NVReader/Viewer

customer_reviews.title: Stuck with the label
customer_reviews.text: The dust pan comes with a good-sized label front and center, affixed with a very sticky, hard to remove glue. I have yet to get the residue off, so I'm sure that once used, that first round of dust is going to make a mess of it. Frustrating and disappointing (stupid) way to package.
customer_reviews.author: mister

customer_reviews.title: Swept Up
customer_reviews.text: I am just so happy that I was able to find an actual metal dustpan like we used to find in the hardware stores. This is obviously before the plastic explosion that I am very unhappy about. I know that I will get many, many years of service from this most excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: brewer13

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good dustpan
customer_reviews.text: I have not used it yet, but it seems sturdy and has a good tight fit to the floor. I've had plastic ones that work for a little, then fall apart. This dustpan would last years. Hope it works as good as it looks!
customer_reviews.author: tauren44

customer_reviews.title: A must have cleaning tool
customer_reviews.text: The dustpan is thin along the edge which makes it easy to sweep up the finest dirt & dust. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Joselle

customer_reviews.title: Hidden Prop 65 Warning
customer_reviews.text: In teeny tiny writing when you get the dustpan home it says, "Prop 65 warning. Wash you hands after touching the dustpan". NO THANK YOU. By the fact that they flat out tell you to wash your hands after touching it, I'm guessing there is lead in the powder coating.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Day

customer_reviews.title: A very well made traditional dust pan
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. I needed a dustpan for my shop and didn't want to split another plastic dustpan. This dustpan is the type I used in shop class. Made of steel, durable, light weight, and the cheapest price I found. I received the dustpan quickly and in perfect shape.
customer_reviews.author: MPL

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and strong.
customer_reviews.text: Stylish and functional. I purchased it to keep out in the bathroom with a black straw broom but put it to work clearing up plaster rubble after a wall demolition. It held up sturdily and washed up very nicely. Looks great and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Dinkin

customer_reviews.title: Durable.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a dustpan that would last and not dry up in the Nevada sun. This dust pan is simple but as described it does not bend and lays flush with the ground. I have not had this dust pan long but I am sure that it will be just what I need.
customer_reviews.author: babz

customer_reviews.title: tired of plastic
customer_reviews.text: It is so nice to have a metal dustpan again. I have broken 3 plastic dustpans since the first of the year. Hip hip hooray for metal.
customer_reviews.author: Reader Lady

customer_reviews.title: Strong and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The dustpan is sturdy, and it'll probably last a long time. The handle is wide and difficult for me to hold onto to. Although it's perfect for my husband.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa F.

customer_reviews.title: Just like the old dustpans were
customer_reviews.text: Love the dustpan. It is sturdy and has a great depth and a clean beveled edge that you can sweep or rake up any thing you need to. I used it to rake all the gravel out of my lawn after the county plow deposited snow gravel and mud along 400 feet of my lawn. Worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Rosgen-Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Well-made and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a well-made metal dustpan to replace the junky plastic ones that wear out fast and end up sitting in a landfill for 1000 year. So we bought this dustpan for our garage and various outdoor uses. So far it's held up perfectly. Looks great, well-made and sturdy! Having the lifetime warranty is a nice bonus, and something that is sorely missing in household products these days.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Hancsak

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy dust pan
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new dust pan for the ashes in my wood stove and this really fits the bill! Nice, sturdy and large enough to take care of the job.
customer_reviews.author: MT Geri

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This dust pan is heavy enough to just lay flat on the floor while you sweep dirt in. No dirt gets under the dustpan. The sticker the other reviewers mentioned was inconvenient but came off with Goo Gone and scraping. I normally would just pick up a dust pan locally but the stores either did not have any or they were very flimsy. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Diane D

customer_reviews.title: Durable, non-flammable essential item
customer_reviews.text: This should outlast me. Can't imagine a point of failure. The most important factor? For me, non-flammability. My woodstove hot ash goes in the galvanized bucket, as does hot ash from the hibachi. The edge is nice and sharp, and not much gets left behind.
customer_reviews.author: Shari A. Mann

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and strong.
customer_reviews.text: I love stuff that lasts a long time, If not forever! This is perfect for around the house and I love that it's not made from plastic. It picks up all the dirt easily. And It's surprisingly lightweight. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: GreenCowLand

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this dustpan, it's a nice size, not to big or small. It is sturdy so hopefully it will last along time. My plastic dust pans always got so gross looking overtime. The main reason I bought this I am moving away form buying plastic when possible, plastic doesn't last and it sits in landfills forever!
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: This dust pan is very durable, sturdy and large, it has a lip in the front where All the dirt your sweeping in actually goes into the pan!!!! Amazing, being so many I have bought most of the dirt goes under the pan because of the front lip part. Thank's for a great product, I would highly recommend this dust pan. I use it for many thing's, It's great for sweeping up ash in our fireplaces.
customer_reviews.author: A. bauer

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: The clean up edge is Flat unlike most plastic models. When the edge is not flat it makes it difficult to total clean up leaving a pile of crumbs on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: GiGi

customer_reviews.title: High quality, heirloom piece
customer_reviews.text: I use this dustbin for the ashes that seem to want to escape fro the wood stove. It is well made and one of those things that will be around for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Cooper-Wyble

customer_reviews.title: The dogs can't eat this one!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a dustpan that's not too heavy nor cumbersome, but is also dog-proof. I found my last dustpan in bits in the back yard, which made cleaning up all the dust around the house a bit challenging. As an added bonus, this dustpan also does not melt nor light on fire when I use it to toss the collected dust directly on my fire. In all, I am quite happy with my purchase. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: This is a great purchass
customer_reviews.text: I really like that it is a great quality product, sturdy and looks great. It will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: C. Spotts

customer_reviews.title: Picks up dust
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Huge and picks up every little crumb of dust.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Excellently made.
customer_reviews.text: My go-to dustpan. I know it will outlast me. Very well made!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Ann

customer_reviews.title: Great Dust Pan
customer_reviews.text: Could not find a sturdy smooth edged dust pan at any retail location... found this one at Amazon and it is perfect for our outdoor/yard clean up.
customer_reviews.author: KAYLA

customer_reviews.title: Sturdiness
customer_reviews.text: I like the design. Easy to hang for storage. The only complaint: The sticker on the dustpan does not peel off.
customer_reviews.author: Isabel Bohn

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed and I love it! Just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Newman

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased because I was tired of broken plastic dust pans
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty cleanup
customer_reviews.text: This dustpan is sturdy, looks and feels well made. Edge is FLAT; we all know what help that can be (unless you like sweeping the same dirt over and over). Handle is heavy enough to lift those heavy messes without worrying. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Nolan P. Critchlow

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty!
customer_reviews.text: Seems a little high priced for a dustpan, but when I got it, I decided it was well worth the money. It's heavy duty and should last for years!
customer_reviews.author: Ladycat

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Enjoying this dust pan, well made and sturdy. I gave it four stars because my one complaint is that dust and dirt get trapped under the “arms” of the handle and it’s a bit annoying...
customer_reviews.author: N.T.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, durable, and functional
customer_reviews.text: It is just what I wanted. The extra bracing makes it extra durable but it also can be inconvenient when cleaning wet or sticky substances out of the pan. I also had a heck of a time getting the sticker off the pan. (Maybe put it on the bottom)
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: My son is in love with my dustpan so I may be reordering this again!!
customer_reviews.author: Lady Themis

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Well designed, excellent construction, easy to use and aesthetically pleasing. A great product, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Giles, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sturdy Dustpan
customer_reviews.text: This is not your cheap plastic flimsy dustpan. This is substantially constructed and good for indoor or heavier shop cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Alan

customer_reviews.title: Metal Dustpan
customer_reviews.text: It is a well built metal dustpan and a good addition from the plastic ones. It also was bought for a friend and it is perfect for her use outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Old school
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy light weight, but heavy duty. The kind your school janitor used in the 80’s
customer_reviews.author: Jt

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: The dustpan was good quality. When I opened it, it was smaller than I expected but after looking back at the description, the misunderstanding was my fault. After using it, I realized that the smaller size was what I really needed. I am a small, old lady and would have had a harder time handling a bigger dustpan made from metal. All in all, a good product.
customer_reviews.author: DAK

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Great quality product and great value. It room a little work to get the sticker off but definitely worth the extra effort!
customer_reviews.author: Hildy A. Straightiff

product_meta.title: Edward Tools Black Metal Dustpan 12” - Heavy Duty Powder Coated Steel does not chip or bend - Precision edge for small item sweeping - Loop handle for comfort/hanging (1)
product_meta.description: Package Quantity:1Edward Tools Black Metal Dustpan 12” is the most heavy duty metal dust pan on the market. The premium powder coated steel will not chip or bend like other dust pans on the market. The looped handle is more comfortable and allows the dust pan to be hung up when not in use. This industrial dust pan’s edge is thin enough to sweep small items but thick enough to not bend. A ridge just inside the edge allows the swept items to stay inside while work. Edward Tools Black Metal Dust Pan 12” is the perfect size for a standard broom and comes with a lifetime warranty!
feature_bullets: Heavy duty powder coated steel that does not chip or bend like competing metal dustpans
Precision edge for easier sweeping small items
Looped ergonomic handle for easier grip and to allow hanging dust pan after use
Lifetime warranty - We guarantee our dust pans for life

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars776 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
